alert.note: Alert for Kern River Valley; South End of the Upper Sierra (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:07PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL TULARE COUNTY THROUGH 630 PM PDT... At 606 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm just southeast of Johnnsondale moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. Isolated heavy rainfall could lead to nuisance flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Isolated heavy rainfall could lead to nuisance flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Tulare County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Kern River Valley; South End of the Upper Sierra
